title: Define variables
text: Give the first unknown number a variable (like x) and set the second number interms of $$x$$

title: Setting an equation
text: Based on the question if $$x$$ is the first number then $$3x+3$$ would be the second number. Now create an equation representing the sum of the two numbers which equals $$-5$$

title: Seperating constants
text: The equation equals $$x+3x+3=-5$$. Now we will seperate the constant numbers to one side. Remeber if you subtract from one side you are also subtracting from the other side

title: Seperating variable
text: The equation equals $$x+3x+3=-5$$. Now we will seperate the variables to one side. Remeber if you subtract from one side you are also subtracting from the other side

title: Find $$x$$
text: Now that we have seperated $$x$$ and constants your equations should be $$4x=-8$$. Now find what is the value of $$x$$ by dividing both sides by $$4$$

title: Number $$2$$
text: Now that you have found the first number which is $$x$$, plug that number back into the equation for the second number to get the value for the second number
